definition[0]: to put something over something else so that it cannot be seen
example[0]: Her legs were so swollen she had to cover them up.
definition[1]: to prevent people from discovering mistakes or unpleasant facts
example[1]: The affair was covered up and never reached the papers.
example[2]: Mumâ€™s worried, but she covers it up by joking.
definition[2]: to protect someone by hiding unpleasant facts about them
example[3]: They covered up for Kirk by refusing to answer any questions.
definition[3]: to put clothes, blankets etc over yourself in order to protect or hide your body, or to keep yourself warm
example[4]: Cover up, or stay out of the sun.
example[5]: Hastily, she covered herself up with the towel.
definition[4]: an attempt to prevent the public from discovering the truth about something
example[6]: He accused the government of a cover-up.
